content:
=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
Here's an analysis in plain language:

• Game Genre and Overall Feel:
 – It’s a tile‐based puzzle/action game (like many PuzzleScript titles) in which you control an avatar in a maze‐style level.
 – You must navigate through obstacles, collect a key to empower yourself, and then exit the level by reaching a door.

• Key Mechanics:
 1. Movement & Environment: The game is played on a grid. Walls are immovable obstacles that force you to change direction (the “stepBack” rule). The floor tiles provide the background while other items and characters are placed around them.
 2. Collecting the Key: Early on your avatar (represented in the level as a swordman “A” or a “nokey” character) must interact with a key (displayed in orange). When you touch the key, a transformation takes you from “nokey” to “withkey” (the character’s appearance changes) and you earn a score bonus.
 3. Enemies and Combat: There are several types of roaming monsters (fast, normal, slow) that move randomly on a cooldown. You can attack enemies by shooting a “sword” – a flickering oriented sprite – since colliding with an enemy directly results in a penalty even though it might also kill the enemy. Hitting an enemy with your sword earns a bonus score.
 4. Using the Door (Goal): Once you have collected the key (i.e. you’re now “withkey”), you can interact with the door (the goal, colored green). Touching the door with the key triggers an interaction that “kills” (removes) the door sprite, which in turn meets the win condition.

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 – Main Objective: Collect the key, then navigate to the door to exit the level.
 – Win Condition: The level is cleared (and you win) when the goal (door) sprite is removed, which happens when you approach it while carrying the key.
 – Loss Condition: If your avatar is eliminated (for example by direct contact with enemies without proper control), the game ends with a loss.

• Overall Strategy:
 – First, explore the level carefully to locate and collect the key. This transformation gives you access to the door and possibly improves your abilities.
 – Avoid or neutralize enemies smartly. Use your sword (which you can shoot) to take them out from a safe distance rather than colliding with them—since direct contact causes a score penalty and might lead to your destruction.
 – Plan your route through the maze: Know where walls block your path and be mindful of the enemies’ random movement patterns.
 – Once you’re “withkey,” move toward the door (goal) to complete the level swiftly, but be cautious of any remaining threats.
 – Keep an eye on scoring: Neutralizing enemies with your sword boosts your score, but caution is key if you accidentally run into them.

In short, the game is a blend of maze navigation, enemy dodging, and strategic combat. Your best approach is to secure the key first, make safe eliminations using the sword attack, and then head for the door—all while planning your moves to avoid being caught off guard by enemies.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== High Level Plan === 


Evaluation: BAD 
Feedback: The action (4) did not result in any progress toward reaching the goal or improving the agent's situation. It appears to have been ineffective, creating no strategic advantage while also not decreasing risk, resulting in no reward. with a reward of 0.0 from the environment

Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
floor goal -> 'g'
floor key -> '+'
floor nokey -> 'A'
floor monsterQuick -> '1'
floor monsterNormal -> '2'
floor monsterSlow -> '3'
wall -> 'w'
floor -> '.'
goal -> '@'
key -> '#'
monsterNormal -> '$'
monsterQuick -> '%'
monsterSlow -> '&'
nokey -> '*'

=== Current State ===
=== Original State ===
wwwwwwwwwwwww
w..&.ww...*.w
w....w......w
w.w.....wwwww
w#w........%w
w.w..wwwwwwww
w.......w...w
w...$w....w@w
wwwwwwwwwwwww

=== Rotated State (Y-axis emphasis) ===
wwwwwwwww
w...#...w
w..www..w
w......&w
w$......w
ww.w..www
w..w...ww
w..w....w
w.ww.w..w
w..w.w..w
ww.w.w.*w
w@.w%w..w
wwwwwwwww
Note: In the original state, each row corresponds to horizontal (left-right) layout in the game.
In the rotated version, each row corresponds to vertical (up-down) layout.=== Map in Natural language ===

===Long-term Plan===
**goal strategy: Once transformed to withkey, approach the door via cautious navigation through the floor goal zone, preemptively mitigating enemy threats** with Alert
